message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY

The paper discusses the design and training of bio-inspired Spiking neural networks (SNN) for spatial-temporal information processing, which falls under the category of neural networks (cs.NE). The paper also proposes a novel training algorithm for SNNs, which involves optimizing synapse filter kernels and weights, and this optimization process can be considered as a form of machine learning (cs.LG). The applications of the proposed SNN model and training algorithm include constructing associative memories and classifiers for image datasets such as MNIST and NMNIST, which are related to computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper emphasizes the importance of preserving temporal information in SNNs, which is relevant to the field of control systems (cs.SY).
